briefTitle: The EVARREST® Fibrin Sealant Patch Liver Study

outcomeMeasures.title: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 4-minutes Following Randomization
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis at the TBS at 4-minutes following randomization and with no re-bleeding requiring treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of wound closure. Hemostasis is defined as no detectable bleeding at the TBS.

outcomeMeasures.title: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 10-minutes Following Randomization
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization and no further bleeding requiring treatment prior to initiation of wound closure.

outcomeMeasures.title: Absolute Time to Hemostasis
outcomeMeasures.description: The absolute time to achieve hemostasis at or after 4 minutes from randomization.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Re-bleeding Events From the TBS During the Study Follow-up
Incidence of Adverse Events That Were Potentially Related to Thrombotic Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants with adverse events that were potentially related to thrombic events
